intro:
Easy to Drive
A crowd of people gathered outside a car showroom. They were all looking at a new car that was being shown in the showroom window. The car was an automatic model that made it very easy to drive.
The salesman came out into the street and noticed the crowd. "Good drivers will find this car a dream to drive," he said confidently. "Women will find it especially easy because it's automatic and needs no gears. Watch, I'll give you a demonstration."
The salesman got into the car and started it up. He drove a few yards forward, then reversed. The car moved smoothly and effortlessly. However, as he was reversing, he accidentally pressed the accelerator too hard, and the car reversed straight into the showroom window, smashing the glass.
Everyone gasped in surprise, and the salesman looked embarrassed but quickly stepped out of the car and said, "It's definitely easy to drive, but a little too powerful!"

items.prompt: Did a crowd gather outside a car showroom or inside it?
items.answer: A crowd gathered outside a car showroom but they didn't gather inside it.

items.prompt: Is the car easy for everyone to drive or just for good drivers?
items.answer: The car is easy for everyone to drive but it is not just for good drivers.

items.prompt: Did the salesman give a demonstration or did he just talk about it?
items.answer: The salesman gave a demonstration but he didn't just talk about it.

items.prompt: Were the people in the street looking at a new car or at an old one?
items.answer: They were looking at a new car but they were not looking at an old one.

items.prompt: Has the car any gears or is it automatic?
items.answer: The car is automatic but it does not have any gears.

items.prompt: Is it easy or difficult to drive?
items.answer: It is easy to drive but it is not difficult.

items.prompt: Does the salesman think that women are good drivers or bad drivers?
items.answer: The salesman thinks that women are bad drivers but they are not good drivers.

items.prompt: Did the salesman give a demonstration or did a member of the crowd give a demonstration?
items.answer: The salesman gave a demonstration but a member of the crowd didn't give a demonstration.

items.prompt: Did the car go forward or did it reverse?
items.answer: The car reversed but it didn't go forward.
The people were standing outside the car showroom.

items.prompt: Why did the salesman come into the street?
items.answer: The salesman came into the street to give a demonstration.

items.prompt: Why is this car easy to drive?
items.answer: This car is easy to drive because it is automatic.

items.prompt: Which car did the salesman drive?
items.answer: The salesman drove the new car.

items.prompt: How did the salesman break the showroom window?
items.answer: The salesman broke the showroom window as he drove backwards instead of forward.
